Description: A very large cylinder bead: of green glazed composition, the glazed surface having slightly decayed in parts. The bore is of elliptical shape.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Temple of Osiris-Khentimentu (Abydos), Chamber M 69 Deposit
Curator's comments: Chamber M seems to have been used as a rubbish hole: the objects in it were generally damaged. The latest pottery and flints date to the reign of Peribsen and the jewellery is not likely to be much earlier. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), 23, 26. Similar beads are shown on pl.VIII, 168; E. A. Wallis Budge 'A Guide to the Fourth, Fifth and Sixth Egyptian Rooms, and the Coptic Room' (London, 1922), 290, no. 227.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (187)
